intro: Nectris, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, often pink or purple flowers. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. Nectris species are typically shrubs or small trees, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. They are often found in moist, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and clearings.
